MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Summary of Episode 1. 
You meet up with Alexandra who had been wailing all alone in the desert.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Uuuuuhh, wahhhhh! Wahhhhhhh! 
I regret everything I've done, so please don't leave me!
Alright alright. You're fine, I'm not going to leave you. I should be the one apologizing here… We only just now noticed that you were gone.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Huhhh? 
You didn't leave me because I disobeyed you…?

Leaving someone in the desert is less of a punishment and more like a death sentence. 
The SSS isn't the mafia, we'd never do something like that.
In fact, I'm sorry for making you do something you didn't want to. I promise there won't be any more unreasonable requests. Can you forgive me… Alexandra?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hnnnnngh! H-hmph! As long as you know, okay! Try and pay more attention next time, okay?
Yes, of course. But you're fine now, so please stop your crying… You have to be mindful of water in the desert.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I-I, I, I, I'm not crying! I'm just getting my eyes wet to protect them from the sand. This is common desert folk knowledge!

Oh, I see. Learned something new today. 
You'll definitely be a big help now, Alexandra.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hm. 
But I'd honestly ask you not to get your hopes up.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So I missed the train earlier, see… I tried sandswimming like you had ordered me to and couldn't… It had been so long since I did it and I had forgotten how to. I couldn't even get out of the sand.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: By the time I had dug myself out, you all had disappeared with the train, so I panicked.
I see now… So you really were trying to help out with the mission. Then there wasn't even a reason to punish you at all.
That reminds me. I think you did just fine sandswimming. Where we are now is pretty far from where we have the train parked.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Huh? Oh…You're right. How did I even end up here? So I wasn't even left behind… It was me that ran away in a sense?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I guess I didn't even realize being so panicked… Uhhh, so from where we are now, the train is over there? Ohhh, I can see it way in the distance!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Uuhhh? Why didn't I notice right away? 
I didn't need to freak out at all!

I was able to figure out where you were with all your crying. It all turned out alright in the end. But it's pretty easy to get lost in a desert without any landmarks. You sure you have the train in your sights?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Sure I do? There are all kinds of landmarks… You can use all the stars in the sky at night. And during the day you have cactus and boulders, don't you?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: You're more of a city boy, so you didn't know that, huh? Getting lost in the desert means death. That's why my parents would always warn me to keep an eyes out for stuff like that.
I see. This is really useful information. And everything you think might be common sense isn't really that common.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What? Are you praising me? 
Why not be a bit more direct and just call me cute or something?
I'll make sure I pay attention. But standing around here chatting in the middle of the desert is going to waste energy. Let's get back to the train where we have some air conditioning enchantments.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hmm… We do need more water. 
I'll make you some of my famous juice blend to make up for worrying you.
Can't wait. After that we should get back to the mission. We had hoped your sandswimming would get us somewhere… But I guess we'll have to think of another way-- Any ideas?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Our mission this time around was to investigate some ruins buried in the sand. 
That's something my people have been doing for ages too…

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Alright, I'll do it. No need to think of another way in. I'll just dive right in-- Right into the sand.

Really? 
You'll sandswim for us? Don't you hate it?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I do. It's lame and uncomfortable and I get all dirty, just the worst… But you've already seen me at my worst covered in sand bawling my eyes out.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's a bit too late to be embarrassed. There's nothing fun in a desert, it's so boring. Let's get this over with so we can go home.

Right, let's do it. 
I know I've said this plenty, but you really are a huge help, Alexandra.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Eheh. That's right, don't you forget it. Next time I want you to send me on a fancier mission. Something that goes along with how cute I am…
The missions we go on are by nature plain, messy and boring.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Alexandra
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yeah, yeah. Ughhh, how did I end up here? Eh, it's fine. A hundred times better than being stuck in the desert.
As she said that, you could see a smile form on her face as bright as a desert sun.
To be continued in Episode 3.
